benchmark_details.name: BEA -Base: A Benchmark for ASR of Spontaneous Hungarian
benchmark_details.overview: BEA-Base is a dataset created to provide a benchmark for assessing Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) of spontaneous Hungarian speech. It is designed to facilitate the training and evaluation of ASR systems, especially for conversational AI applications, by utilizing spontaneous speech from a diverse set of speakers.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a benchmark dataset for Hungarian ASR training and evaluation, primarily focusing on spontaneous speech to improve the performance of ASR systems.

data.source: BEA spoken Hungarian database comprising spontaneous speech of 140 speakers.
data.size: 71.2 hours of training data, 4.02 hours of development data, 4.91 hours of evaluation data
data.annotation: Manual transcription and segmentation of speech data.

methods: End-to-end Neural Network using CRDNN and GRU
methodology.calculation: Standard evaluation based on WER and CER calculated against transcriptions of spontaneous speech.
methodology.interpretation: A lower WER and CER indicate better performance of the ASR system in recognizing spontaneous Hungarian speech.
methodology.baseline_results: Best results achieved are WER of 15.61% and CER of 5.11% on the spontaneous evaluation set.
methodology.validation: The spontaneous evaluation set was used for validation during the training of ASR systems.
